data.title: Add Node Subtypes Summary Cheat Sheets
data.body: As a newbie at Gamedev and Godot, I think a Cheat Sheet summarizing Node Subtypes (one for 2D and another for 3D) would be helpful. Some minutes ago I was considering to implement a Tile Map as I did once from scratch using SDL, but suddenly I stumbled upon the Tile Map node subtype in the pallete (lucky me, otherwise I probably would miss an opportunity to save me time and learn a cool Godot feature). Maybe I could help write it someday.

data.title: Problem importing project from few weeks old version of Godot.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Xubuntu Linux 14.04 64-bit, Godot compiled from github few hours ago.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I was importing a project.
Project was created around version 2.0 stable release - but my Godot was always compiled from Github.
Lately my project was edited in newer version of Godot from 2-3 weeks ago, 2.1 alpha, DynamicFonts were implemented already. Few days ago I changed all my fonts into DynamicFont. It was working great. 

Now, when I import, the project imports fine for the first time, but fonts are not visible.
The paths to the fonts(in UI) are gone and size reset to 16. Colour of the fonts is changed to black, even if the font colour square shows (is checked) the proper colour I set for the font in previous version of Godot.

After selecting the font again and changing colour, the font shows again. - it's size looks wrong, but can be changed.

However, when I save the project in such state (with some of the fonts recreated and some not), or without recreating the fonts at all, but just opening the project and saving, it will not open again. It shows in the project manager, it starts to load, but after a while quits, leaving no error messages.
The last line I see in the terminal is:

> bind toptions
> LOCAL PATH: res://main_scene.scn from res://main_scene.scn

I will try to reimport from backup and recreate all fonts, to see if that helps, so I will report back with the results.

**REPORTING BACK:**
Unfortunately repairing all the fonts and saving the project did not change anything.
The project does not open.
### TEST PROJECT

[check.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/297461/check.zip)

To recreate the bug one needs to:
1.     scan projects directory form project manager
2.     open the project from project manager
3.     when project opens, save it right after it opens - do not correcting invisible fonts, or correct only one of the two labels.
4.     quite project to project manager or quit Godot completely
5.     repeat the process to open the project again - it fails to load.

data.title: Global Font setting in Editor Settings broken.
data.body:
Linux 64-bit, but I got a confirmation from OSX as well. Godot compiled 5 hours ago from head
![godot_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11817561/15765096/0a1aadd2-2931-11e6-9c5a-0fadaf6b6181.png)
.

In Editor Settings, in the Global, the Font settings can't be set. The folder icon is gone and using the path does not work. Probably because having a custom font now, that one should not be present in the settings at all.

data.body:

Windows 10

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
No uv textures are exported from blender or imported into godot.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Created simple cube with UV texture - blender render.
File->Export->Better Collada
Select all options, but there is no option for uv texture export.
Import scene in godot.

data.title: change invalid characters when get user data dir on Windows & Unix
data.body:
Can't create user data folder when project name has `\ / : * ? " < > |` characters on OS_Windows & OS_Unix.
So, change it to `-` to be able to make folder.

fixes #4928.
It's altanative to #4986, but this one has no restriction to make project name.

It's up to @akien-mga to merge which one and close. :)

data.title: Added classes' short descriptions as tooltips in the create dialog.
data.body: Each entry in the create dialog now has the corresponding class's short description as a tooltip, so beginners can get a first help without having to switch back and forth between the create dialog and the help files.

data.title: The create node dialog now starts collapsed.
data.body:
This was a suggestion by one of my students to make the editor more beginner friendly.
Every node except for the root node starts collapsed now, so you aren't presented with a wall of text right away.
Once you start typing in the search box the tree unfolds automatically.

If you prefer the tree to start expanded you can uncheck the "start collapsed"-option in the Editor settings' "create dialog" tab.

data.title: "Case" keyword is not treated as reserved in GDScript
data.body:
The docs says that [`case` is a keyword](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/reference/gdscript.html#keywords) "reserved for future implementation". The GDScript's tokenizer don't recognize it, so it can be used as an identifier.

So either the documentation should be changed or the `case` keyword should be reserved to avoid people using `case` as variable/function name.

data.title: Shrink By option does not work if altas ON
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, 2.1 alpha with 182ee80

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Shrink By option does not work if altas ON.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. make an image group at Project Export Settings > Image Groups
2. chage Compress Mode to Compress Disk
3. change shrink by option value to 4
4. export project and run
5. can see blurry image
6. make Atlas ON
7. export project and run
8. can not see blurry image (not shrink)

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: fix crash and error with texture atlas
data.body:
- crashes at Project Export Settings > Preview Atlas
- error message when export project

```
ERROR: EditorImportExport::get_import_plugin_by_name: Condition ' !by_idx.has(p_string) ' is true. returned: Ref<EditorImportPlugin>()
   At: tools\editor\editor_import_export.cpp:1548
```

it is caused by https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/8be2fabbe5cd846bac5e5a38e55f3fb70e73f2da#diff-67a74bd708380c6b3baa717bb178dd47R802

data.title: Godot crash at disconnection of RemoteDesktop session
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Latest dev build as of writing this, happens with stable version too.
Win10 x64, but I think it applies to other windows versions or Linux/MacOSX

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Godot crash when disconnecting a RemoteDesktop (RDP) session. But to be more precise, It works fine during the session. And after I disconnect from the remote PC, logging in the same PC (with disconnected session), Godot shows "it stopped working, looking for solutions from Microsoft". Thankfully, I save my work regularly, but this issue could cause the loss of unsaved work.

data.title: Built-in scripts don't autosave when executing project
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Ubuntu 16.04 LTS 64-bit, Godot 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected): When using built-in scripts they won't be autosaved by running the project. I have to hit ctrl+s to save the script before executing or changes won't be reflected. External scripts are saved automatically so this is unintuitive and was initially quite confusing.

**Steps to reproduce:** Make a built-in script on some node, add some code, save and run. Stop running the game, change the script and hit the play button or F6. The script changes won't be reflected unless you manually save the built-in script with ctrl+s.

Obviously this is a minor issue but it was a bit of a tripping hazard until I figured it out.
